item.title: Software Developer lll, Augmented Reality
item.description:
2022-02-14T22:31:37.430Z

Software Developer lll, Augmented Reality

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 2 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.
  • 2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master\'s degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical fields.
  • Experience developing accessible technologies.
  • Experience building Android applications and services.
  • Experience with Android test tools such as Junit, Mockito, and Robolectric
  • Experience with optimizing CPU, memory, and battery usage in a resource constrained environment.
  • Familiarity with Android best practices regarding IPC, AIDL, Broadcasts, Intents, and Permissions.

About the job

Google\'s software developers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We\'re looking for software developers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software developer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our software developers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

The Google Augmented Reality team is a diverse group of experts tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and building helpful, delightful user experiences. We\'re focused on making immersive computing accessible to billions of people through mobile devices, and our scope continues to grow and evolve.

Responsibilities

  • Build robust libraries and services to be used by other Experience teams within Google.
  • Design, implement, and test robust new features in an early stage, but rapidly maturing, codebase.
  • Optimize performance of Android services and libraries using your expertise with Android internals, getting as much value as possible out of available CPU, memory, and power budgets.
  • Participate in, or lead design reviews with peers and stakeholders to decide amongst available technologies.
  • Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).

Location

item.title: Cloud Database Migration Developer, Professional Services
item.description:
2021-10-04T10:47:50.399Z

Cloud Database Migration Developer, Professional Services

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
  • + 2 more locations
Apply

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Toronto, ON, Canada; Montreal, QC, Canada; Vancouver, BC, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience writing software in Java, C++, Python, Go, and/or JavaScript.
  • Experience with database technologies such as PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle.
  • Experience with database administration techniques.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working with cloud databases such as RDS, Aurora, DynamoDb, ElastiCache, CloudSQL, Datastore, Firestore, or Cloud Spanner.
  • Experience developing ELT or ETL workflows.
  • Experience with data migration strategies and moving large scale production systems either in on-premise/data center environments or migration to cloud scenarios.
  • Experience in technical consulting.
  • Experience with database performance tuning and database management tools for backups, recovery, snapshot management, partitioning.
  • Query troubleshooting knowledge such as isolating blocks of poor performing SQL, determining root cause, and developing remediation actions.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what\'s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability, and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees, and partners.

As a Cloud Database Migration Developer, you will guide customers on the migration of transactional database systems to Google Cloud Platform. You will work with customers to explain technical requirements and assist in designing, planning, managing, and troubleshooting the data migration process. You will travel to customer sites to deploy solutions and deliver workshops to educate and empower customers. Additionally, you will work closely with Product Management and Product Engineering to build and constantly drive excellence in our products.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Be a trusted technical advisor to customers and solve complex database migration challenges.
  • Analyze on-premises and cloud database environments and consult on the optimal design for performance and deployment on Google Cloud Platform.
  • Create and deliver best practices recommendations, tutorials, blog articles, sample code, and technical presentations adapting to different levels of key business and technical stakeholders.
  • Travel regularly, up to 60% of the time, in-region for meetings, technical reviews, and onsite delivery activities.

Locations

item.title: Analytical Lead, Travel
item.description:
2022-01-28T18:01:33.515Z

Analytical Lead, Travel

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience with client-facing analytics or strategy consulting.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience working cross-functionally and building relationships with external clients and internal teams.
  • Experience using SQL, R, or similar tools.
  • Experience with digital marketing and web analytics platforms.
  • Demonstrated ability to use storytelling to lead effective client and internal meetings.
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize using a principled approach.

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google\'s key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As an Analytical Lead, you will be a strategic analyst, advisor, and consultant, providing data supported insights to clients and agencies to help improve their business. You will also be an influencer to teammates and clients in how they think about measuring the value that they get from their marketing efforts.

In this role, you\'ll work with some of Google\'s most advanced performance advertisers to prove and maximize Google\'s impact on their business objectives. You will work with advertising agencies and clients as a team member on Google\'s industry-focused Sales team, exchanging knowledge regarding client and agency needs within specific industry sectors.

You will work with a cross-functional team to present integrated, data-driven business opportunities based on internal and external tools analysis. You\'ll own measurement for your vertical and work with advertising agencies and clients to create impact on their business.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Plan and execute client-specific measurement roadmaps to improve client’s measurement maturity.
  • Advise on and execute analytical methods (e.g., attribution, experimentation, and media mix modeling) to prove the impact of Google media on client business objectives.
  • Build and own client relationships with media and analytics decision-makers to influence investment and measurement decisions.
  • Leverage Google, market, and client data to uncover growth opportunities for clients\' businesses and inform their digital marketing investment strategy with Google.
  • Advise clients on best practices for marketing analytics within broader context of industry standards, and provide ongoing customer consultation on how to implement best practices.

Location

item.title: Enterprise Sales Developer, Security and Compliance, Google Cloud
item.description:
2021-10-04T13:25:23.445Z

Enterprise Sales Developer, Security and Compliance, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience in virtualization or cloud native architectures in a customer-facing or support role.
  • Experience addressing CIO and CISO concerns about security and compliance risks.
  • Experience in performing technical presentations or public speaking.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Advanced degree (i.e. MBA, Master\'s).
  • Experience with tools, technology and best practices in network security, data protection and identity and access management.
  • Technical business experience or professional consulting experience.
  • Knowledge of ISO 27001, SOC 2/3 audit, FedRamp, PCI, and HIPAA.

About the job

The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global network, web-scale data centers and software infrastructure. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.

As a Sales Developer focused on Security and Compliance, you\'ll address technical security and compliance challenges during engagements with customers and partner with internal stakeholders to improve products and build solutions.

In this role, you will be the security and compliance subject matter expert to differentiate Google Cloud to our customers. You will help prospective customers and partners recognize the power of Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, and conduct problem-solving for any potential roadblocks.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Work with customers to resolve existing and potential technical security and compliance obstacles, to adoption and consumption of Google Cloud services.
  • Enhance knowledge and drive technical security and compliance enablement internally at Google Cloud, and create best practices for our customers.
  • Work cross-functionally as a customer advocate to provide insights and contribute to programs in areas of security, privacy, and regulatory compliance with internal teams, e.g, Marketing, Product Development, Legal, and Policy teams.
  • Serve as a public advocate of Google Cloud and Cloud Computing at conferences, industry training, and related events.

Location

item.title: Partner Learning Program Manager, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-03-02T00:32:28.795Z

Partner Learning Program Manager, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline or equivalent work experience.
  • 5 years of experience developing and/or running training and certification programs and with experience in Program Management.
  • Experience developing and managing technical competency models and learning paths for technical roles.
  • Experience working with and leading cross-functional, geographically dispersed teams.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience building relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners.
  • Experience navigating various training workstreams simultaneously with attention to detail.
  • Experience with Google Cloud or other cloud platforms.
  • Experience with Learning Management System and other training related tools.
  • Ability to take a strategic approach, taking concepts and develop structured planes, actions, measurable metrics, and drive goals.

About the job

In this role, you will provide support for partner learning programs and will manage various training programs to support the partners ecosystem. You will develop detailed tracking of programs including scope, resourcing, task management, timelines, return on investment (ROI), and overall results.

You will work with cross-functional teams on multiple projects including in-person training, e-learning, learning paths, and training campaigns. You will also report figures internally, analyzing data, and translate this into creative/effective presentations.

Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Partner with executive leadership, partner-facing teams, and global teams to identify knowledge and skills required by gaps across the partner ecosystem.
  • Work with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and support training/certification campaigns to provide training at scale to Google partners.
  • Identify and engage third-party vendors, trainers, facilitators, instructors, and more to build a learning community and drive training and certifications.
  • Design and implement metrics to measure training programs and impact, effectiveness, appropriateness, and utility. Build and manage training dashboards, and track/report the progress and performance of the partner training programs.
  • Conduct assessments on existing training assets, identify content gaps, and build plans to address it. Own the execution and roll-out of training programs, including communications, curriculum development, and other enablement aspects for Google Cloud partners.

item.title: Strategic Insights Lead, Retail
item.description:
2022-02-24T21:01:49.556Z

Strategic Insights Lead, Retail

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
Apply

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in digital marketing, marketing research, analytics, and/or consulting.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience analyzing large and complex datasets and managing first and third-party research and tools.
  • Experience in behavioral science.
  • Experience using SQL, R, or similar tools for forecasting or modeling.
  • Knowledge of digital marketing and Google products.
  • Ability to translate complex ideas into simple stories.
  • Excellent project management, organizational, communication, analytical, and leadership skills.

About the job

Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google\'s key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.

As a Strategic Insights Lead (SIL), you\'ll serve as a strategic thought partner to sales teams through data-driven storytelling and actionable insights for positive client growth and relationship outcomes. You will join a small and growing team that has a front-row seat for the digital transformation underway across all retailers in Canada. You will have the opportunity to develop scalable, client-centered stories built with “only-at-Google” insights to position Google as a strategic thought leader. You will also oversee the development of high-quality, custom research in order to uncover novel and actionable ideas that optimally position Google’s product offerings and drive business strategies.

Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We\'re uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google\'s broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.

Responsibilities

  • Help tell unique, actionable stories for clients.
  • Lead development of scalable narratives that enable success for the team in priority areas.
  • Lead consumer-focused primary research programs to unlock growth opportunities.
  • Advocate storytelling principles and high-quality visualization, enabling elevated customer conversations.
  • Work closely with the other strategic insight leads to execute engagement. Partner with the Heads of Industry, Account Executives, and Analytical Leads to deliver on strategic goals.

Location

item.title: Principal, Customer Value & Transformation Advisory, Google Cloud
item.description:
2022-02-24T00:31:57.486Z

Principal, Customer Value & Transformation Advisory, Google Cloud

  • Google
  • In-office:
    Toronto, ON, Canada
  • + 3 more locations
Apply

Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Toronto, ON, Canada; Montreal, QC, Canada; Calgary, AB, Canada; Vancouver, BC, Canada.

Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor\'s degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 8 years of experience in Value Engineering, Strategy Consulting, or Account Sales in cloud computing or technology.
  • Experience delivering and implementing digital transformation strategies.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience with tech investment models and the Google Cloud Platform.
  • Knowledge of value selling methodology and processes, opportunities, value chain, and value realization across cloud technology.
  • Knowledge of data center transformation.
  • Ability to influence finance leadership. Ability to influence and deliver business growth with minimal resources and direction.
  • Excellent verbal, written, and formal presentation, communication, and facilitation skills.

About the job

As a Principal in our Customer Value & Transformation Advisory team, you will use Value Engineering methods to deliver Board Level justification and execution strategies. Working with the global Sales team, you will demonstrate broad knowledge of digital transformation and Google solutions, as well as an ability to lead cross-functional product and industry teams.

As a Principal, you will engage directly with our customers to create compelling business cases, incorporating effective storytelling and strategy analysis skills that further engage leaders. You will develop methodologies to foster business and technical growth as well as innovation opportunities. You will also set priorities with Sales leadership and review deliverables for strategy, content, and delivery quality in your region.

Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities

  • Act as a cross-functional leader to craft business strategies for Google Cloud partners and clients.
  • Manage relationships with regional sales leadership to set priorities on agreement coverage and build effective enterprise sales best practices.
  • Develop business growth creation and implementation strategies to support client priorities.
  • Lead design thinking/digital transformation workshops with client leadership.
  • Lead data center transformations to Google Cloud Platform initiatives.

item.title: Design Specialist II - Data Scientist - Wireless Access Networks
item.description:
Description

 

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies. 


Join our team and what we’ll accomplish together


The Wireless Networks and Service Dev Ops is an operational team that works with all aspects of Engineering and our clients to ensure that TELUS continues to deliver on its best network commitment, backed by third party awards such as Ookla\'s "#1 in Mobile Network Speed in Ontario", PC Mag\'s "Canada\'s Fastest Mobile Network" and Open Signal\'s "Fastest Overall Download Speed". 

We are always looking for new ways to identify and resolve network problems through data science innovation. 

With the increasing complexity of radio systems and the advent of 5G wireless technology, you will have the opportunity not only to master new technologies, but also apply modern data science best practices, including automation and machine learning to build a wireless network that delivers excellence in network performance and client experience. 
You will be an integral part of the Wireless Networks and Service Dev Ops in Ontario.  Developing tools to support network performance.  Troubleshooting network issues through data & software development.


  
What you’ll do 


• Participate in the development of tools and dashboards to analyze wireless network KPIs in search of network issues that impact the client experience
• Apply your knowledge in data science, such as big data analytics and advance automation opportunities that improve the team’s efficiency in find root causes of network issues
• Use your knowledge of network virtualization and cloud computing platforms
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams like Technology Strategy and Product Development to understand new technologies and services to prepare our team to succeed in an evolving business environment such as 5G and IoT
• Analyze dashboards and create data visualizations: You will provide insight into client experience that can be shared with executives, peer groups and tools that are implemented in customer portals
• Help to proactively identify network problems and avoid client issues on the wireless network, through automation, machine learning, etc. 
• Participate in small to medium size projects which require analytics or capability development (such as analysis or reporting)
 

Qualifications

 

What you bring


• With 1-3 years’ of experience working in data science, computer science or related field
• Recognized for your passion for developing tools and using data analytics to improve networks
• Hands on experience with network virtualization and cloud computing platforms such as Open Stack and GCP
• Acknowledged for your strong understanding of databases and big data, including MySQL, NoSQL databases (such as MongoDB, Netezza, Splunk, Hadoop)
• You have technical working knowledge of containers technology, such as Docker, PCF, and Kubernetes.
• Willingness to learn data analytics tools like Tableau, Alteryx and Splunk (preferred).
• Demonstrated innovation to introduce change for improvement in work efficiency and cost savings 
• Valued for your ability to consult and communicate with various levels of management
• With your valid G driver’s license or other provincial equivalent
• With a Bachelor degree in Computer Science or Engineering

 

Great-to-haves 


• Understanding and experience in 5G/LTE radio network optimization & performance, analysis of KPIs, investigation and improvement of network quality problems (Volte Drop Calls, MOS Score, DL/UL Throughput…etc.)
• Programming experience with C#, JavaScript, Python, Perl

item.title: RF Design Specialist II
item.description:
Description

Be a part of a transformational journey with innovative talent and leading edge technologies.

 

Join our team

 

The wireless engineering team is a group of highly motivated and talented RF Engineers who have a passion for deploying the network infrastructure to achieve best in class network services to our customers. We are the team that engineer our 5G national RAN network.

The team is always at the cutting edge of wireless technology delivering the newest and the best services to our customers. With the advent of 5G, you will have the opportunity to work with peer RF Engineers to design the network while leveraging your automation, data science, and machine learning skills.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As an Engineer II, you will collaborate with peer RF Engineers and provide technical support to ensure we efficiently deploy network infrastructure to meet the increasing customer demand for wireless services.

Your efforts will ensure that our millions of customers are able to enjoy a world class wireless network experience. Your creativity coupled with strong automation and big-data analytical skills will allow us to find the most efficient ways of building our wireless network to support existing mobility services and offer future new services.  We are searching for an engineer with extensive experience in both Macro RAN & Microwave RF design. 

 

Here’s how

 

•    Using RF propagation modelling, you will develop novel techniques to simulate wireless coverage supporting the evolution of our networks (5G and IoT)
•    Collaborating with internal teams like Technology Strategy and Product Development to understand new technologies and services to prepare our team to succeed in an evolving business environment
•    Lead the implementation of wireless capacity augments, you will build working processes with performance and construction teams to drive improvements in customer experience
•    Developing dashboards and data visualizations you will provide insight into network performance that can be shared with executives, peer groups and tools that are implemented in customer portals 
•    Keeping up-to-date with software, data science, and RF technologies while proposing new ideas for platforms and tools
 

Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Bachelors degree in electrical engineering
•    Distinguished for your 5-years minimum experience in a RF engineering team (specifically with Macro RAN designs)
•    With a deep insight of industry standard propagation tools (ex. Planet, ATOLL) 
•    Respected for your knowledge of 3GPP (LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
•    Recognized for your strong understanding of databases and big data including MySQL, NoSQL databases, SPLUNK, Python and Alteryx
•    Valued for your effective communication skills while collaborating with both technical and non-technical team members
•    Commended for your inter-personal skills, critical thinking, analytical, and problem solving skills
•    Passionate about automation, data science, and machine learning

 

Great-to-haves

 

•    Masters degree in Engineering or Computer Science
•    Knowledge of Tableau, Splunk or Alteryx
•    Experience with some of the following programming languages: C/C++, Java
•    Experience with SQL, database design and development (MySQL, SQL Server, PostgreSQL Oracle, Hadoop, MongoDB…)

item.title: Manager, Data Science/Strategy
item.description:
Description

Join our team


The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a mission to help TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions by delivering data analytics capabilities built on modern scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product culture. Our team members appreciate diversity of thinking, ideas and experiences, and are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.

 

The DSE team fulfills its mission by providing core services to the enterprise including advanced analytics & AI, data engineering and platform modernization along with data management enhancements to drive governance and quality improvements – all of these to drive exceptional customer experience and business performance outcomes for the organization.  With an elevated focus on data to drive our business, we are creating this new role to support strategic data-intensive initiatives in Health IT and new product areas. 

 

Your transformative role

 

You will work in a multi-faceted role – engaging in data science, data engineering and data governance contexts to develop the data strategy and data solutions in both TELUS Health and new product areas. You will apply TELUS wide policies and guidelines to ensure that there is overall convergence and alignment on data approaches to produce high quality, well-governed, effective data solutions and products.

 

Specifically, you will:

 

  • Work with business leads to understand the business strategy and formulate the requisite data strategy that supports and ensures product success.
  • Research the relevant domain knowledge and recommend what appropriate analytics and data architectures are warranted. 
  • Keep abreast of emerging technologies and standards. Recommend approaches to integrate classic decision-oriented architectures with more modern AI and machine learning -based approaches
  • Advise the product team on appropriate data resources and implement a resourcing game plan, as required. 
  • Establish the data management and governance framework to ensure data integrity is assured through its entire life cycle – from collection to transformation, to modeling and insights to retention and removal.
  • Participate in the analysis/evaluation of proposed specific use cases: economic, technology, return on investment, sensitivity etc…
  • Empower and help team members to resolve complex technical, process and business roadblocks.
     

Qualifications

 

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • Advanced degree preferred in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, Health Informatics, Software Engineering or related field
  • AI Technology & Data Engineering Expertise: Deep technical knowledge and 3+ years’ experience in deploying AI and machine learning solutions, applying data science techniques to generate actionable insights and achieve economies of scale
  • Experience in healthcare or IT regulated industry experience (e.g. Telecom, Financial services)
  • Experience with data modeling, data engineering & big data ((processing and analyzing high volume, unstructured data on distributed platforms))
  • Operational Leadership: Extensive experience in engaging with stakeholders to understand business opportunities and leading cross-functional teams to deliver innovative cloud and applied platform technologies
  • Solid experience evaluating and implementing industry interoperability standards to simplify system integration efforts.
  • Business & Financial Acumen: Strategic investment expertise, with the ability to own the overall financial strategy around people, processes and technology, while ensuring strong delivery on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills
  • Significant experience working with agile software development methods, such as scrum and Kanban.
  • Prior experience establishing and maintaining data quality standards


Great-to-haves

  •   Experience implementing decision support systems is a plus

item.title: Senior Data Scientist
item.description:
Description

Join our team


The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data solutions, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI solutions, high quality data, and a data-product oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing. We are entrepreneurial, and live by our AI Manifesto of failing fast and being outcome vs technology driven, creating value for our customers, team members, communities, and the environment.

 

The team takes pride in our Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning capabilities and takes ownership of each step of the process. From hypothesis generation, initial exploring of datasets, developing novel AI techniques to discover insights, to developing automation pipelines and web-visualizations, we do it all! Always wanted to work with a team of innovators touching all business units within TELUS, and be part of a culture that embraces creativity and collaboration? If so, we’d love to talk with you!


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You’ll be a part of the team and journey that will transform the way we do business across various domains. You’ll collaborate with teams across the company, seeking out various data sources to help identify new business opportunities while championing data driven decision making and the accelerated adoption of AI. As a Data Scientist on the team, you will combine your expert knowledge of data science with your strong software development skills to automate and facilitate data exploration, analytics, machine learning model development, training and deployment and will leverage your experience in building reusable algorithms, functions and libraries.
 

Qualifications

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, predictive modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques in which you have previous hands-on work experience
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP, optimization, and deep learning and bring 3 or more years of hands-on work and practical business experience in the above areas
  • You are a master communicator capable of breaking down technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  •  You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras and have applied these skills towards solving actual business matters
  • You have experience architecting and deploying end to end AI solutions in the cloud with reliability, scalability, security, and privacy considerations
  • You are comfortable in and with a Jupyter environment and infrastructure, and familiar with GitHub
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL and distributed computing
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles, including ML Ops
  • You are agile and have a bias for action, removing roadblocks to get results fast

 

Great-to-haves

  •  Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, or Data Science
  • Experience with agile methodology and work in a start-up environment
  • GCP or other cloud certifications

Here\'s How

  • Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models
  • Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production
  • Work with structured and unstructured raw data to design and develop innovative predictive models, metrics, and dashboards to uncover actionable insights
  • Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization
  • Influence how we approach business challenges and opportunities by driving the adoption of a data driven mindset
  • Develop re-usable code aimed at delivering on future goals faster and more reliably
  • Support and evolve the Advanced Analytics and Data Science roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities

item.description:
Join our team

As a Data Scientist on the team, you will leverage your expert knowledge of data science to automate and facilitate machine learning model development, training and deployment. item.title: Manager, Data Science
item.description:
Description

 

Join our team

 

We are the TELUS Data Strategy & Enablement team and our mission is to drive TELUS to become a world-class data insights driven organization, delivering world-class data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data and a data-product/data platform oriented culture. Our team members are passionate, dynamic, entrepreneurial and highly engaged, driven to achieve great outcomes for our customers, our team members, our communities and our environment.

 

We believe in continuous meaningful transformation integrating dynamic change in our professional lives. Our team members are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.

 

Here’s how

 

You will lead a team of data experts (Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Data Analysts) to drive solutions in collaboration with our marketing, sales, business solutions, security, privacy teams and TELUS-wide AI focused teams. Building on our existing strengths in privacy, analytics and strategy, and architecture, you will:

 

  • Communicate with various stakeholders, identify use cases, data requirements and test hypotheses.
  • Develop technical domain knowledge, operationalize the application of AI insights and decision making and manage our team’s delivery lifecycle and business models.
  • Inspire and motivate team members to drive high performance, take calculated risks, drive sound business decision making and quality outcomes.
  • Evolve our underlying data pipeline to deploy reusable and scalable algorithms in partnership with privacy and security functions.
  • Perform analysis/evaluation of proposed specific use cases: economic, technology, return on investment, sensitivity etc…
  • Manage capital/operational budgets and headcount while balancing between the needs and targets of the team versus the evolving fiscal environment of the business.
  • Empower and help team members to resolve complex technical, process and business roadblocks.

Qualifications

 

 You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • AI Technology & Data Engineering Expertise: Deep technical knowledge and 3+ years’ experience in deploying AI and machine learning solutions, applying data science techniques to generate actionable insights and achieve economies of scale.
  • Team Leadership: You have 3+ years of experience in a role managing people. Excellent communicator with a track record of building strong teams, driving a culture of high engagement, and delivering outstanding program results.
  • Business & Financial Acumen: Strategic investment expertise, with the ability to own the overall financial strategy around people, processes and technology, while ensuring strong delivery on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
  • Operational Leadership: Extensive experience in engaging with stakeholders to understand business opportunities and leading cross-functional teams to deliver innovative cloud and applied platform technologies.
  • Executive Reporting Expertise: Ability to serve as the primary communication link and provide executive updates on cross-TELUS AI programs and the overall health of these initiatives.
  • Process Automation Know-How: Strong analytics, digitization and process automation knowledge.
  • Bachelor or Master degree in Engineering, Data Science, Computer Science or related fields

 

Great-to-haves

 

  • MBA (Master in Business Administration)
  • Master of Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science or related fields
  • Deep understanding of cloud computing environments, and the associated analytics opportunities and challenges
  • Strong knowledge of industry pressures in the telecommunications industry

item.title: Manager - Planning & Engineering (Wireless Radio Network Capacity)
item.description:
Description

Make strategic decisions that will shape the future

 

Join our team

 

The RAN Capacity team is a group of highly motivated engineers and data scientists who have a passion for delivering the network capacity needed to support our customers increasing demand for wireless service. Our team is responsible for the capacity planning and engineering of TELUS’ award winning wireless networks. This includes a broad range of planning and engineering activities, from projects that guide executive strategy to implementing network augments that support customer traffic at special events (e.g. New Year’s Eve celebrations).

This is an opportunity to join a highly visible, dynamic team during a transformational journey. With the increasing complexity of radio systems and the advent of 5G wireless technology you will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning, but also shape the future of our 5G networks to deliver continued award-winning customer experiences.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As the leader of the wireless capacity team, you’ll provide technical and people leadership to ensure we efficiently deploy network capacity to meet the increasing demand for wireless service. You will leverage your deep technical knowledge of AI and Machine learning in conjunction with your entrepreneurial spirit to take calculated risks and drive the continued transformation of the wireless capacity team through the use of automation and data science.

Your ability to lead, your competitive spirit, your passion for innovation, and your strong RF engineering background all coupled with your keen knowledge and experience leveraging AI and ML will allow us to find the best ways of shaping our wireless network not just to support existing mobility services but to cater to the next generation of use cases that 5G brings. Finally, together as a team, we will help shape the future vision of TELUS’ wireless network by providing important guidance to executives on how to best address our evolving business challenges. You and your team’s efforts will ensure that our millions of customers are able to enjoy a world class wireless network experience.

Description

Here\'s how

 

•    Provide leadership and support to the wireless capacity team so they can continue to build on their data analytics and software development capabilities
•    Ensure strong team engagement and enhance a sense of close connection regardless of geography
•    Facilitate ongoing learning and development in the latest wireless network technologies and best practices
•    Provide ongoing informal and formal coaching and face to face meetings
•    Collaborate with the planning and implementation teams to ensure that the produced capacity plans get deployed at the right time in the network
•    Act as an ambassador and point of contact for TELUS wireless service(s) and confidently present findings and presentations to senior leadership
•    Cultivate strong, collaborative partnerships with other leaders, including Strategy and Product Development teams to understand new technologies and services to prepare your team for success in an evolving and competitive business environment
•    Challenge, inspire, and motivate team members towards continued improvements, skills development and technical innovations by leveraging machine learning techniques, you will identify capacity issues in the network
•    Continue to push the status quo – integrate, implement and improve on current network tools/technologies
•    Identify new solutions to capacity issues with data science methodologies including big data analysis, to improve the efficiency of TELUS’ capacity plan
•    Lead your team in developing new dashboards and data visualizations with the goal of providing insight(s) into network capacity which will then be shared with executives and peer groups

Qualifications

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Known as an inspiring leader who coaches and develops team members, cultivating a highly engaged and high performance team
•    Noted for your expertise in 3GPP (5G/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
•    Strong knowledge of AI and ML, demonstrated use of leveraging big data for driving decisions
•    Regarded as an exceptional communicator, influencer and negotiator, able to build and maintain strong partnerships with internal and external stakeholders
•    Recognized as having strong business and financial acumen who drives innovation, change and process improvements
•    Experienced with Agile and DevOps software development practices
•    Respected for your track record of operational execution and delivery excellence and achieving results in a complex environment
•    Noted for your strong analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and poise when faced with difficult challenges
•    Sought out for your knowledge in network capacity dimensioning (wireline or wireless)
•    Mastery in being able to craft stories that turn complex ideas into simple concepts
•    Respected for your courage to take risks, lead innovation and explore unchartered territory within the technology and telecommunications space
•    Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering

 

Great-to-haves

 

•    MBA or Master’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering
•    Experience with swarm intelligence and/or generative artificial intelligence
•    Experience deploying NodeJS app, microservices, cloud application deployment or distributed systems
•    You possess a strong understanding of databases and big data, including: MySQL, NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB, Splunk) 
•    Prior experience with at least one or two programming languages: JavaScript, Python, R, Go, C#

item.title: Design Specialist II - RAN Performance & Optimization
item.description:
Description

Join our team

 

There’s a lot of buzz around the next leaps in wireless network optimization, leveraging data science, big data and machine learning. Join a team that is re-thinking how we optimize our wireless network by blending wireless engineering, computational analysis, and programming. At TELUS, with over 9 million subscribers, there’s a lot of data being generated from our network, and with this lies untapped potential for data mining and advanced insights towards improving our customers’ wireless experience. 

As a member of Eastern Canada\'s wireless network performance team, you\'ll be responsible for optimizing the Radio Access Network (RAN), and finding new angles/methods to improve network performance, efficiently. You\'ll join the larger Wireless Networks & Services DevOps team that is providing TELUS customers with the most reliable network and the best user experience in every region of the country.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

In our team, you\'ll ensure our customers\' wireless experience continuously improves. Your "think outside of the box" and innovation will help shape our Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that we use to govern our customers\' wireless experience. Also, your data science and automation mindset will provide inputs to our tools team to improve the quality and efficiency of the way we do network performance engineering.
 

Description

Here’s how

 

•    You\'ll be responsible for the network performance of a region in Eastern Canada
•    You’ll ensure network performance KPIs are meeting our targets, and are continuously improving
•    You’ll troubleshoot network degradations, determine root causes, and look for ways to prevent or reduce the impact to our customers
•    You’ll support network upgrades by analyzing the impacts on performance, and proposing optimizations to enrich the overall customer experience
•    You’ll aid our client support teams for escalated issues that may require network engineering to resolve
•    You’ll be exposed to the latest wireless technology innovation planned for TELUS, and be ready to support their launch from a performance management perspective

Qualifications

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Bachelor degree in Engineering
•    3+ years of relevant professional experience
•    Excellent knowledge of LTE radio access network optimization and performance engineering: parameter optimization, layer 3 messaging, mobility management and traffic balancing
•    RAN equipment knowledge: parameters, capabilities and limitations of the hardware and software portfolio
•    Good wireless core network knowledge (VoLTE, EPC, IMS) and 5G technology
•    Proficient with ActixOne and Netscout
•    Familiar with SPLUNK, SQL, Python (or other scripting languages)

 

Great-to-haves

 

•    Masters of Engineering
•    Samsung/Huawei RAN equipment knowledge
•    Advanced programming skills for automation and big data manipulation (Hadoop, SPLUNK, Python, SQL, Tableau)
•    Machine learning experience or certifications

item.title: Data Scientist
item.description:
Description

 

Ready to create innovative solutions and best practices?
 

Join our team

 

TELUS is looking for a passionate and talented Data Scientist to join a highly skilled and dynamic AI Analytics team. In this role, you will create Machine Learning solutions to enable various stakeholders to better understand TELUS’ customers needs and help them meet customers’ inquiries in advance. 

Your work can impact millions of people and change their lives for the better. At TELUS, we’re building a better future for all Canadians by using our technology for good and giving back to our communities. Our social purpose is at the heart of everything we do as a world-leading technology company and continues to set us apart. Let\'s make the future friendly, together.

 

Customer Experience AI, Data & Analytics Spotlight:

 

  • Our team works in a fun, innovative and challenging environment that directly influences the strategic direction and performance of the Customer Experience business
  • Our team is responsible for driving insights from various call center data sources. The ten year strategic partnership between Google Cloud and TELUS enables us to also leverage Google Contact Center AI capabilities for various text mining solutions.
  • We work closely with our stakeholder teams to deliver on our strategic objectives; our key stakeholders and partners include Operations, Technology, Marketing, Finance.

 


Transformation and more

 

  • We provide opportunities for you to excel and show your stuff: work on high value and high visibility projects.
  • We have flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office.
  • You will work in a team that actively supports your personal development with progressive training and development tools.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Data Scientist, you’re in a great company, working alongside some of the brightest and creative Data Scientists, Data Engineers and Data Analysts. You will be part of the journey that brings us to a better understanding of our customers, in order to predict their needs and interaction behaviour. 

With your expert knowledge and experience in Machine Learning, you will contribute to the development of state of the art ML & AI driven solutions.

 

Here\'s how


 
 

  • Lead the development and implementation of ML & AI and Big Data solutions including NLP modeling, customer impact assessments, customer journey analytics, etc
  • Support and evolve the AI Insights roadmap by leveraging industry research, best practices and emerging tools/technology
  • Execute, oversee, and evolve models and algorithms selection to deliver solutions that are relevant and facilitate decision making
  • Build and maintain a strong engagement with key stakeholders to understand business needs and priorities
  • Identify opportunities for process/model optimization and refine to improve effectiveness/accuracy and enhance ROI  
  • Collaborate with Data Scientists and Data Engineers within TELUS as well as external Data Science communities

Qualifications

 

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

 

  • You are recognized for addressing business needs via your application of data mining and analysis, NLP modeling, statistics and other advanced analytical techniques
  • You are sought out for your skills in Machine Learning (Supervised and Unsupervised), Classification, Clustering, Segmentation, NLP, and Optimization, with a portfolio to showcase. 
  • You are capable of delivering technical and complex concepts in a way that is understood by non-technical audiences
  • You have solid development experience with Python and you are comfortable using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras
  • You are comfortable with Jupyter environment and infrastructure, as well as know what GitHub, Spyder/PyCharm are
  • You possess advanced knowledge in SQL
  • You are familiar with at least one of the cloud computing platforms - GCP, AWS, Azure
  • You are well versed in software and AI development lifecycles
  • You are a collaborative, creative, open-minded individual who possesses a natural curiosity and desire to experiment with novel algorithms and technologies to perform hypothesis testing and validation, and develop ML-driven models through an iterative approach

 

Great-to-haves


 

  • Masters or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or Data Science
  • Data visualization experience: Data Studio, Tableau, PowerBI, Domo, or Looker
  • Data environments experience: MS SQL, Oracle
  • G-Suite experience
  • Experience with agile methodology and team-based software development workflows (e.g. JIRA)

#LI-REMOTE

item.title: Senior Product Manager - TELUS Partner Hub COE - Affiliate & Ventures
item.description:
Description

#LI-Remote

The TELUS Business Solutions - Emerging Product Team is looking for a talented, driven, passionate individual with strong analytical, interpersonal, and collaboration skills. The ideal candidate will be inquisitive, curious and not afraid to try different approaches to solve a problem. Most critical will be the ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders across various marketing, finance, sales and operations. 


 
Your focus will be developing and overseeing enabling, scaling and evolving strategic partnerships in context of TELUS affiliates (M&A candidates or those that are acquired) and TELUS Ventures-back strategic partners in the space. The work here is aligned to business mandate of TBS Industry Solutions portfolio (next generation solutions anchored on 5G/IoT and data) and will work very closely with the internal and partner teams executing on the strategy to ensure a compelling benefits realization approach. The ideal candidate should have proven experience in technology and services industry with a focus on partner tactics, ecosystem enablement, and co-innovation models. 

 

What you’ll do in this role:

 

  • Role will be reporting directly to the Director of Emerging Tech Product due to the TELUS first/TELUS Business Solutions first framework impact of the assignment, role and outcome. 
  • Overall end-to-end enablement ownership of strategic partners (affiliate and ventures) with strong emphasis on managed services discipline and emerging technologies (anchored on 5G/IoT/Data and other new technology derivatives: business platforms, Industry 4.0 capabilities and others).
  • Manage planning, delivery and post-acquisition, post venture strategy development for targets of interest. 
  • Develop strategic, operational, financial and value stream enablement plans with program team and greater stakeholder group.
  • Develop competitive differentiation and benchmarking against TELUS\' competitors, as well as revenue acquisition, retention and amplification strategies. 
  • Develop forecasting revenues and units by product and customer segments aligned to target PLT owners. 
  • Develop, support execution of product/technology/services and operational roadmap for TELUS Partner Hub evolution
  • Develop, support execution of new product service introduction objectives 
  • Provide/lead internal & external processes innovation strategies to drive and improve customer experience for the TELUS Business Solutions
  • Provide product expertise to as well as lead national, cross-functional value chain team
  • Support development and implementation of industry-leading product & pricing strategies to maximize profit growth and retention
  • Support first year enablement of revenue and performance KPI before full on post-acquisition integration of before next round of TELUS Ventures funding
  • Optimize product profitability by establishing competitive price structures that capture value in the market, and meeting product and process rationalization and optimization targets
  • Manage the performance of Service Delivery for the Portfolio
  • Design scaling and transition strategy for affiliate and ventures pipeline for the greater TBS and TELUS organization.

 

       

      What you bring:

       

      • Experience in technology and services market research, focused on Partnership opportunity identification and Partner funnel development 
      • Experience building an ecosystem of strategic partners in support of new market development aligned to network effect (multi-sided networks).
      • Knowledge on sourcing and contracting partner, team agreements, contracting models and review process
      • Knowledge of contract strategy, pricing 101 and next generation multi-contract enablement

item.title: Senior Consultant - Community Platforms & Sustainability (Emerging Technology)
item.description:
#LI-Remote

Join our Team 

 

Interested in inventing the future?


 
You’re part of a team that will shape the evolution of communication, technology and value add services and help our clients stay connected to the people and things that matter to them most. The Sr. Consultant, Community Platforms & Sustainability focused on Emerging Technology is responsible for supporting the innovation, incubation and solution development of key next-wave technologies that we need to position to the market. 

 

At TELUS, we are looking for people that like solving big problems in a team based organizational structure. We believe that our shared success is as much about what you bring to the table everyday as it is about your skills and qualifications. Smart, motivated people that work well in teams can move mountains!

 

TELUS is a great place to work. You can see it in our team members. The diversity of the TELUS team and their unique contributions set us apart from the competition. Our success is based as much on our future friendly team as the innovative internet, voice, data and wireless products and solutions we offer to consumer and the business markets.

Your enthusiasm for learning and innovation, love of a challenge and leadership capabilities will be keys to your success.

item.title: Design Specialist II - Geospatial Analytics
item.description:
Description

Join our team

 

The RAN planning and GIS team are a group of highly motivated engineers and business analysts who have a passion for developing and instigating wireless strategy across multiple engineering, implementation and business units. The team is responsible for aligning budgets, organizing work flow and clearing roadblocks amongst numerous partners to ensure the successful planning and rollout of wireless build programs, nationally. Overseeing a broad range of investment drivers, the team leverages big data analytics and geospatial analysis to refine business cases to bring forward new wireless build program investments across Canada.

This is an opportunity to join a highly technical, dynamic team during a transformational journey. With the increasing complexity of radio systems and the advent of 5G wireless technology you will have the opportunity not only to influence the introduction of new technologies and leverage your expertise of modern engineering best practices, including automation and machine learning, but also build a wireless network that delivers continued award-winning customer experiences.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Design Specialist with an area of focus on geospatial analytics, you will contribute by developing and implementing key tools and databases in the cloud environment for business intelligence equipping the team to drive and support the future of our network build in this evolving 5G environment. You will be in the forefront of not only driving efficiency but the potential for innovation is endless.

 

Here\'s how


•    Spearhead continued improvements of tools and processes and fuel innovation by leveraging automation and data science techniques
•    Database administration and design
•    Support ETL & big data processes
•    Software development
•    Utilizing Agile methodologies
•    Working with API integrations

Qualifications

You\'re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

•    Experience with GIS Spatial data or mapping software
•    Experience with coding/scripting language like Python
•    Experience working in cloud environment like GCP, AWS, CI/CD GitOps
•    Experience with database management.
•    MSSQL, MYSQL, Postgres, Oracle, Big Data, Big Query, Spatial SQL
•    Experience with web development, HTML, Javascript (React)
•    Ability to effectively configure, process and analyze data
•    Detail oriented and analytical thinker
•    Committed to continuous learning and innovation
•    With a Bachelor of Computer Science and/or equivalent related degree

 

Great-to-haves

 

•    Has some knowledge in 3GPP (5G/LTE/UMTS/HSPA) radio access network design, optimization and capacity engineering
•    Familiarity with SPLUNK, Tableau, Alteryx, BluePrism, QGIS
•    Proficiency in Google Workspace

item.title: Senior Technical Product Manager - TELUS Business Solutions Emerging Technology Product Team
item.description:

Interested in inventing the future?

 

You’re part of a team that will shape the evolution of communication, technology and value add services and help our clients stay connected to the people and things that matter to them most. item.title: Data Scientist - Data Analytics
item.description:
Description


Join our team

 

Our Team – TELUS Business Solutions Marketing BI - has a mandate to build solutions for our stakeholders using data to drive business outcomes.  We love to turn data into stories - stories about money falling through the cracks, success stories about our products and services, but most importantly stories about our customers and how we can enhance their experience.

 

Come join our team if you have a passion for data, analytics, marketing, the courage to innovate, embrace change and embody spirited teamwork to support stakeholders across a wide variety of teams.

 

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

 

As a Data Scientist in the team, you will be working with Business Stakeholders and the campaign team to identify use cases, build machine learning models to protect the customer base, acquire new customers and to enable intelligent marketing campaigns.  Your solutions will have a direct impact on marketing sales targets and P&L.

 

Here’s how

 

  • You will build pipelines to bring data required to support the use case
  • You will develop new machine learning models to enable intelligent campaigns

  • Collaborate with business stakeholders to enable new use cases for TELUS Business

Qualifications


You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

 

  • You have experience leading large scale projects and  partnering with multiple stakeholders
